channel.title: The debate for OSX v XP?
channel.description:
Ok this is just for fun really... and I'm bored :|.
OSX v XP? Where do you stand?!
I personally stand for OSX Tiger.. I have a windows laptop that I use to host my server but I'm waiting until Silab releases her 400+ ;D.
-Sleep

item.title: The debate for OSX v XP?
item.dc:creator: @SaveSomeFace SaveSomeFace
item.description:
@SaveSomeFace wrote:

For file management and networking, I’ll stick with Windows.

Read full topic
item.source: The debate for OSX v XP?

item.title: The debate for OSX v XP?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Wtf? That Vista exaggeration is so out there…
Linux doesn’t need a fast computer…
Windows doesn’t “hide” viruses, and Mac doesn’t “get” viruses.
Windows isn’t slow because of the RAM problems, it’s slow because of its crap paging file.

Read full topic
item.source: The debate for OSX v XP?

item.title: The debate for OSX v XP?
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

xxlegitxx:

No it really isnt. Nothing supports Linux, and it really doesn’t come with much. Most linux have a different filesystem, and the GUI looks pretty shitty. I’d have to say Vista over Linux. And Mac over Vista.

Vista = You can’t use a fucking computer… EVERYTHING is automated… One click will do a million things…

Linux = Open Source has super Eye Candy that is rather nice if you have a fast enough computer

Mac = Very userfriendly, is not a memory hog, does not hide viruses from you in the even that you get one

Windows = Gives you 1093847192457928345729857 ways to open IE which drives it’s ass into the memory and it will eventually slow your computer down w/ all the shit that the RAM has to deal w/…

Read full topic
item.source: The debate for OSX v XP?

item.title: The debate for OSX v XP?
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

xxlegitxx:

No it really isnt. Nothing supports Linux, and it really doesn’t come with much. Most linux have a different filesystem, and the GUI looks pretty shitty. I’d have to say Vista over Linux. And Mac over Vista.

Most if not all distros use ext3 FS.
Doesn’t come with much? Take a glance at a debian dvd then come back.
Nothing supports linux? Most things are compatible now. Companies are embracing open source.
I don’t see how the gui looks bad. Try out something like xgl or compiz and then say that.
Linux is only as good as you configure it, something non-free (free being as in beer, and as in speech) OS limits you on.

Read full topic
item.source: The debate for OSX v XP?

item.title: The debate for OSX v XP?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

No it really isnt. Nothing supports Linux, and it really doesn’t come with much. Most linux have a different filesystem, and the GUI looks pretty shitty. I’d have to say Vista over Linux. And Mac over Vista.

item.source: The debate for OSX v XP?

item.title: The debate for OSX v XP?
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

[quote=“Sleep, post:40, topic:30279”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=44343.msg639164#msg639164 date=1166401017]

xp coz theres hardly anything for osx and it laggs like hell

OSX lags much less than XP. There’s plenty of stuff for OSX. And, if you don’t have a pc AND a mac, then don’t be so definitive.
[/quote]

Thank you xxlegitxx. I agree there are PLENTY programs for iMac. Some of them are pretty damn cool. Like Garageband or iMovie or etc… it’s eyecandy yes, but it also just is reliable…

The only reason you never hear about viruses for OSX is because no one will take the time to program one to effect 1/4th of all the PC world. It’s true also that iTunes + iMac + iPod is a WAY better combo than iTunes + XP + iPod… iTunes on windows when your multitasking is at times laggy, while you can be making a movie, downloading the newest game, looking for your favorite tracks off LimeWire and be playing RS on a iMac LAG free… do that on windows and tell me what you get, eh?[/quote]
Linux is still better.

Read full topic

item.title: The debate for OSX v XP?
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:33, topic:30279”][quote author=tom d link=topic=44343.msg636854#msg636854 date=1166368576]
xp coz theres hardly anything for osx and it laggs like hell
[/quote]

OSX lags much less than XP. There’s plenty of stuff for OSX. And, if you don’t have a pc AND a mac, then don’t be so definitive.[/quote]

Thank you xxlegitxx. I agree there are PLENTY programs for iMac. Some of them are pretty damn cool. Like Garageband or iMovie or etc… it’s eyecandy yes, but it also just is reliable…

The only reason you never hear about viruses for OSX is because no one will take the time to program one to effect 1/4th of all the PC world. It’s true also that iTunes + iMac + iPod is a WAY better combo than iTunes + XP + iPod… iTunes on windows when your multitasking is at times laggy, while you can be making a movie, downloading the newest game, looking for your favorite tracks off LimeWire and be playing RS on a iMac LAG free… do that on windows and tell me what you get, eh?

Read full topic

item.description:
@byte wrote:

Oh boy. Mac OS X will not contract more viruses just because it’s running on intel chips. Does the linux os running off intel chips contract viruses? No. It’s the security of nix systems, it’s not what hardware you’re running off.

item.title: The debate for OSX v XP?
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

it really depends on what you want. Compatability or system reliability. Windows is compatable with just about everything. Mainly because it is too easy to program. But OSX usuualy only runs system files, unless they are system files with pure authentication(i think by a special hash that is encrypted and decoded by the system) But im not sure myself(i have only used one once at a university)

Read full topic

item.source: The debate for OSX v XP?

item.title: The debate for OSX v XP?
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:23, topic:30279”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=44343.msg551706#msg551706 date=1164948733]

OSX could be the crappiest peice of software on the whole planet - xp would still be worse

Do explain how XP would be worse?

Nothing wrong with XP unless the user is retarded and downloads every single virus he see’s. I’ve pretty much only had one virus in my life that actually made me frustrated and took hours of manual work to get rid of it, but toher then that I haven’t had problems with windows in the last 10 years or so of using it.
[/quote]
So? Spyware is inevitable, so you have to deal with it no matter what. But I have no idea whether OSX has much spyware =[/quote]

Of course spyware is going to popup no matter what OS you’re using but the amount is less because half the time the Virus Coders aren’t going after OSX…

Read full topic

item.source: The debate for OSX v XP?

item.title: The debate for OSX v XP?
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

theliberator:

honestly im not a big osx fan i dont see why people say that xp i sthe worst os ever. if its so bad why the hell does everyone use it?

It’s cheap, computers are cheap… Intel claims to have a good Dual Core… but they got the idea after they worked with Apple for the Intel Core Duo…

And because not many programers go after the oldschool Mac Core… it makes it better for people that do a lot of backdoor stuff, like myself… and besides… iTunes runs better on iMac anyhow… so just because you’re too shitless poor to get a DECENT old iMac that does NOT have an Intel Core… See I’m protected, from most trojans, viruses, etc… But I still scan my Mac every week for misc shit that collects over time… like cookies for instance… and etc.

Read full topic
item.source: The debate for OSX v XP?
